Annual Crop Land: Regular geometrical patterns of ploughed fields.
Forest: Dense, interconnected canopy patterns; biodiversity representation.
Herbaceous Vegetation Land: Dense, Continuous Greenery without Tree Statures.
Industrial Buildings: Larger geometric structures, displaying operational function patterns.
Pasture Land: Open fields primarily used for grazing or hay production.
Permanent Crop Land: Regularized Patterns of Vegetative Land for Year-round Harvest.
Residential Buildings: Dense structures with varied roof shapes arranged closely.
River: Continuous, winding water bodies amidst terrain.
Sea or Lake: Expansive water body with lack of terrestrial elements.
